message_1: A right triangle has a base of 5 cm and a height of 12 cm. Find the length of the hypotenuse of the triangle.
message_2:
To find the length of the hypotenuse of a right triangle, we can use the Pythagorean theorem, which states that the square of the length of the hypotenuse (c) is equal to the sum of the squares of the lengths of the other two sides (a and b). In this case, a = 5 cm and b = 12 cm. The formula is:

c² = a² + b²

Substitute the values of a and b:

c² = (5 cm)² + (12 cm)²
c² = 25 cm² + 144 cm²
c² = 169 cm²

Now, take the square root of both sides to find the length of the hypotenuse:

c = √(169 cm²)
c = 13 cm

The length of the hypotenuse of the triangle is 13 cm.
